description: Students explore the processes involved in the acquisition of Spanish as a first and
second language and the variation present in the language of both native and non-native
speakers of Spanish from Spain, Latin America, and the U.S.  Hispanic linguistics are
studied with special attention paid to the socio-cultural as well as structural aspects.
The course includes the study of at least one substantive literary work.  Includes
pronunciation lab. Taught in Spanish. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: SPAN 250.
fullname: Spanish as a First and Second Language
